intro: Stigmaphyllon tergolanatum, commonly known as the Brazilian rosewood, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to Brazil and is characterized by its woody stems and showy, pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in tropical regions and is often found in coastal areas and humid forests. It has small, oval-shaped leaves and produces capsules as its fruit. Due to its ornamental value and historical use in musical instrument making, it is sometimes cultivated for horticultural purposes.
